required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brief Intervention and/or Distribution of Free Condoms for Travelers
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of a Brief Intervention and/or Distribution of Free Condoms During Pre-travel Consultation on Sexual Behaviour Abroad: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess the impact of a structured intervention and/or free distribution of condoms during the pre-travel consultation on sexual risk behavior of young persons traveling alone.

detailed_description.textblock: All persons aged 18 - 44 years planning to travel alone and attending the travel clinic of the Medical Outpatient Clinic in Lausanne will be asked to participate. The subjects will be randomized into three groups: 1. no intervention, 2. free condoms without further explanations, 3. a structured intervention of 5 minutes on STI risk reduction plus free condoms. The structured interventions will include information about the number of travelers engaging in new sexual relationships, the different types of STI and their prevalence in different countries and population groups. The subjects will complete a pre-travel questionnaire prior to the medical consultation. A post-travel questionnaire will be sent to them 10 days after their trip. The questionnaires will include questions on demographic characteristics, sexual habits, alcohol/tobacco/marijuana consumption and sexual relationships during the trip.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Had New Sexual Relationships

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Used Condoms Inconsistently

arm_group.description: The subjects will receive a structured intervention on STI's and will be offered free condoms
Subjects will be offered free condoms at the end of the pre-travel consultation
The topic of STI's will not be actively discussed during the pretravel consultation

intervention.intervention_name: Structured intervention for the prevention of sexually transmitted infections (STI).
intervention.description: The structured intervention will include information about the number of travelers engaging in new sexual relationships, the different types of STI and their prevalence in different countries and population groups. The intervention will last approximately 5 minutes. At the end of the structured intervention the subjects will be offered free condoms.
Subjects will be proposed free condoms at the end of the pre-travel consultation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age: 18 - 44 years
- Travelling without the regular partner
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of patient to participate

facility.name: Travel Clinic, Medical Outpatient Department, University of Lausanne

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study participants were recruited between January 2006 and December 2008.The study was proposed by the administrative staff in the waiting room of the travel clinic.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study was proposed to 5148 eligible travelers. 1681 travelers accepted to complete the pre-travel questionnaire. 1115 travelers completed the post-travel questionnaire.

The intervention will last approximately 5 minutes. At the end of the structured intervention the subjects will be offered free condoms.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
